CODIF_DATA.PR_PROC: Negotiated without a prior call for competition
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01B03

TI_TEXT.P: Muturi, ġeneraturi u trasformaturi ta' l-elettriku
Elektromotoren, elektrische generatoren en elektrische transformatoren

SHORT_DESCR.P: Newest-generation dry dilution refrigerator which can be operated without regular liquid helium refills and which allows for a maintenance-free (except of e.g. filling the liquid nitrogen cold trap of the mixing circuit) and automated operation over time scales of at least 1 year.

MAIN_SITE.P: One dry dilution refrigerator/centered pulse tube: Gran Sasso, ITALY
One dry dilution refrigerator/R&D: Munich, GERMANY.

SHORT_DESCR.P: COSINUS (Cryogenic Observatory for Signatures seen in Next-generation Underground Searches) is a new experiment for the direct detection of dark matter based on scintillating cryogenic calorimeters using Sodium Iodide (NaI) scintillating crystals.

To provide the low temperatures (< 10 mK) necessary to operate COSINUS detectors we plan to use a newest-generation dry dilution refrigerator which can be operated without regular liquid helium refills and which allows for a maintenance-free (except of e.g. filling the liquid nitrogen cold trap of the mixing circuit) and automated operation over time scales of at least 1 year.

Special emphasis is put on the low-noise design of the cryogenic system as low-temperature calorimeters are known to be very sensitive to vibrational noise. To reach our physics goal an ultra-low vibrational technology/level is mandatory. The main emitter of vibrational noise in a dry cryogenic system is the pulse-tube cooler itself. To minimise this vibrational noise advanced decoupling solutions that mechanically isolate the head of the pulse tube from the Cryostat body carrying the dilution unit
And the experimental volume are required.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The recent and full market research showed that the company Cryoconcept France is the only company that can deliver a dry 3 He/4 He dilution refrigerator, which can fulfil all our needs. Especially a decoupling solution to minimise the mechanical vibrations of the pulse tube cooler is the crucial advantage of the dry 3 He/4 He dilution refrigerator from Cryoconcept in comparison to other companies, which is needed to guarantee the successful continuation of the COSINUS experiment.
To conclude: Cryoconcept is the the only provider of a thermal coupling between pulse tube cooler and segregation unit which is based on helium gas and which doesn't use stiff mechanical connection.

Also the reason why two dry dilution refrigerators of the same company are needed: the main research work will be done in Gran Sasso, Italy where the first refrigerator will stand. The second refrigerator will stand at the Max-Planck-Instiute for Physics in Munich. As this refrigerator is mainly for R&D purposes, this means the refrigerators from Gran Sasso and Munich need to be nearly the same to guarantee the comparability of their results.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Any violations against procurement rules that are apparent because of this notice have to be reprimanded at the appointed authority (see I.1)) with a period of 10 calendar days after the publication date of this notice (§ 160 Abs. 3 Satz 1 No 1 GWB). If the contracting authority does not redress the reprimand against procurement rules, an apply for review proceedings is only allowed within 15 calendar days (§ 160 Abs. 3 Satz 1 No 4 GWB) since receiving the notice of no remedy. If the before mentioned periods are not adhered a later appeal to the Public Procurement Tribunal because of the reprimand against procurement rules is excluded. The contracting authority asks to send reprimands via email if possible. The contracting authority also points out that it is of the interest of the bidder to send written reprimands as well as proving authority to bring appeals regarding reprimands.
